channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 15 years ago, a software developer paid for two pizzas with 10,000 bitcoin. Those pies would be worth $1.1 billion today
item.description: The two Papa John’s pizzas delivered to Laszlo Hanyecz's Florida home in May 2010 were worth about $41 at the time.

item.title: BCG leader calls for optimism amid AI doom and gloom, says enabling young people to ‘build and shape the future’ is key
item.description: "Children should be encouraged to play with robots, experiment with AI, and learn in the metaverse," says Leila Hoteit

item.title: Wanted: AI with common sense
item.description: Salesforce’s chief scientist explains why common sense—not genius—is the key to making AI work in the real world.

item.title: The Senate just blocked California from becoming the first state to ban the sale of new gas-powered cars as the Trump administration doubles down on fossil fuels
item.description: Republicans say the phaseout of gas-powered cars is costly for consumers and manufacturers, and puts pressure on the nation’s energy grid.

item.title: Gaming industry needs more women to become more ethical and less toxic, industry executives say
item.description: The Middle East gaming industry is growing, but it needs more women.

item.title: The White House wants its tax bill and lower yields. Wall Street isn't on board.
Trump is hosting a private meme-coin dinner. That’s raising ethics concerns.
A 5-star fund manager is capitalizing on Trump’s global market shake-up
How young traders are getting rich betting on things like Rotten Tomatoes scores
CoreWeave’s stock is up 200% in a month. Here’s why it’s so polarizing.
